A (named , plural As, A's, as, a's or aes) is the first letter and the first vowel of the ISO basic Latin alphabet
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is similar to the Ancient Greek letter alpha, from which it derives
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The upper-case version consists of the two slanting sides of a triangle, crossed in the middle by a horizontal bar
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The lower-case version can be written in two forms: the double-storey a and single-storey ɑ
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The latter is commonly used in handwriting and fonts based on it, especially fonts intended to be read by children, and is also found in italic type
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
The horizon or skyline is the apparent line that separates earth from sky, the line that divides all visible directions into two categories: those that intersect the Earth's surface, and those that do not
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 At many locations, the true horizon is obscured by trees, buildings, mountains, etc
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
, and the resulting intersection of earth and sky is called the visible horizon
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 When looking at a sea from a shore, the part of the sea closest to the horizon is called the offing
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The word horizon derives from the Greek "ὁρίζων κύκλος" horizōn kyklos, "separating circle", from the verb ὁρίζω horizō, "to divide", "to separate", and that from "ὅρος" (oros), "boundary, landmark"
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
"OK" (; also spelled "okay" or "ok") is an English word denoting approval, acceptance, agreement, assent, or acknowledgment
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 "OK" has frequently turned up as a loanword in many other languages
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It has been described as the most frequently spoken or written word on the planet
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

As an adjective, "OK" principally means "adequate" or "acceptable" as a contrast to "bad" ("The boss approved this, so it is OK to send out"); it can also mean "mediocre" when used in contrast with "good" ("The french fries were great, but the burger was just OK")
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It fulfills a similar role as an adverb ("Wow, you did OK for your first time skiing!")
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 As an interjection, it can denote compliance ("OK, I will do that"), or agreement ("OK, that is fine")
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It can mean "assent" when it is used as a noun ("the boss gave his OK to the purchase") or, more colloquially, as a verb ("the boss OKed the purchase")
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 "OK", as an adjective, can express acknowledgment without approval
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 As a versatile discourse marker or back-channeling item, it can also be used with appropriate voice tone to show doubt or to seek confirmation ("OK?" or "Is that OK?")
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
The aardvark ( ARD-vark; Orycteropus afer) is a medium-sized, burrowing, nocturnal mammal native to Africa
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is the only living species of the order Tubulidentata, although other prehistoric species and genera of Tubulidentata are known
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Unlike other insectivores, it has a long pig-like snout, which is used to sniff out food
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It roams over most of the southern two-thirds of the African continent, avoiding areas that are mainly rocky
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 A nocturnal feeder, it subsists on ants and termites, which it will dig out of their hills using its sharp claws and powerful legs
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It also digs to create burrows in which to live and rear its young
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It receives a "least concern" rating from the IUCN, although its numbers seem to be decreasing
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
The aardwolf (Proteles cristata) is a small, insectivorous mammal, native to East and Southern Africa
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Its name means "earth wolf" in Afrikaans and Dutch
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is also called "maanhaar jackal" (Afrikaans for "mane jackal") or civet hyena, based on its habit of secreting substances from its anal gland, a characteristic shared with the civet
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The aardwolf is in the same family as the hyena
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Unlike many of its relatives in the order Carnivora, the aardwolf does not hunt large animals
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It eats insects, mainly termites – one aardwolf can eat about 250,000 termites during a single night, using its long, sticky tongue to capture them
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The aardwolf lives in the shrublands of eastern and southern Africa – open lands covered with stunted trees and shrubs
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is nocturnal, resting in burrows during the day and emerging at night to seek food
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Its diet consists mainly of termites and insect larvae
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------



 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Abacá ( ah-bə-KAH; Filipino: Abaka [aβaˈka]), binomial name Musa textilis, is a species of banana native to the Philippines, grown as a commercial crop in the Philippines, Ecuador, and Costa Rica
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The plant, also known as Manila hemp, has great economic importance, being harvested for its fiber, also called Manila hemp, extracted from the leaf-stems
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The plant grows to 13–22 feet (4
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
0–6
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
7 m), and averages about 12 feet (3
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
7 m)
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The fiber was originally used for making twines and ropes; now most is pulped and used in a variety of specialized paper products including tea bags, filter paper and banknotes
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is classified as a hard fiber, along with coir, henequin and sisal
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
The abacus (plural abaci or abacuses), also called a counting frame, is a calculating tool that was in use in Europe, China and Russia, centuries before the adoption of the written Hindu–Arabic numeral system
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The exact origin of the abacus is still unknown
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Today, abaci are often constructed as a bamboo frame with beads sliding on wires, but originally they were beans or stones moved in grooves in sand or on tablets of wood, stone, or metal
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Abaci come in different designs
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Some designs, like the bead frame consisting of beads divided into tens, are used mainly to teach arithmetic, although they remain popular in the post-Soviet states as a tool
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Other designs, such as the Japanese soroban, have been used for practical calculations even involving several digits
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 For any particular abacus design, there usually are numerous different methods to perform a certain type of calculation, which may include basic operations like addition and multiplication, or even more complex ones, such as calculating square roots
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Some of these methods may work with non-natural numbers (numbers such as 1
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
5 and  3⁄4)
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Although today many use calculators and computers instead of abaci to calculate, abaci still remain in common use in some countries
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Merchants, traders and clerks in some parts of Eastern Europe, Russia, China and Africa use abaci, and they are still used to teach arithmetic to children
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Some people who are unable to use a calculator because of visual impairment may use an abacus
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Heliaster microbrachius is a species of Asteroidea (sea stars) in the family Heliasteridae
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
The abacus (plural abaci or abacuses), also called a counting frame, is a calculating tool that was in use in Europe, China and Russia, centuries before the adoption of the written Hindu–Arabic numeral system
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
The Hebrew term Abaddon (Hebrew: אֲבַדּוֹן‎‎, 'Ǎḇaddōn), and its two Greek equivalents Apollyon (Greek: Ἀπολλύων, Apollyon) as a person/being and Τάρταρος Tartaros as a place/time, appears in the Bible as name of a place, time, or personification/incarnation of destructive nature
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In the Hebrew Bible, Abaddon often appears alongside the place שְׁאוֹל (sheol), meaning the realm of the dead
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In the New Testament Book of Revelation, an angel called Abaddon is described as the king of an army of locusts; his name is first transcribed in Greek (Revelation 9:11—"whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon, The Angel of Death
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
" (Ἀβαδδὼν), and then translated ("which in Greek means the Destroyer" (Ἀπολλύων, Apollyon)))
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The Latin Vulgate and the Douay Rheims Bible have additional notes (not present in the Greek text), "in Latin Exterminans", exterminans being the Latin word for "destroyer"
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
This is a list of Latin words with derivatives in English (and other modern languages)
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Ancient orthography did not distinguish between i and j or between u and v
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Many modern works distinguish u from v but not i from j
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In this article, both distinctions are shown as they are helpful when tracing the origin of English words
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 See also Latin spelling and pronunciation
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Armed and Hammered was a hardcore punk band from Toronto, Ontario, spawned from the Kensington Market, BFG (Bunchofuckingoofs) scene
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 They played their first show June 7, 1989 and their final show on April 19, 2003
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Originally formed by singer Mopa Dean, the bassist for Masochistic Religion, arguably Canada’s foremost goth band, and drummer Kyle, the earliest lineup also included Lamo, Philphee and BFG's Thor
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 By the time of Armed & Hammered's first release in 1991, the Fully Loaded cassette the latter three had given way to Hardcore Dave (guitar) and Kieran (bass), beginning the long revolving door of membership
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Armed and Hammered briefly reunited to play a set in support of GBH for their tour visit to Toronto in July 2010 and reformed in May 2012
In 1992, guitarists Big John and Dorian Wilde had replaced Hardcore Dave
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 This line-up was featured on the next several releases: the split 7-inch records with Suckerpunch and Oppressed Logic and tracks on the various artists compilations Dead on the Road and Living in Fear
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

They were once banned from a repeat performance on Much Music
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It was when they were playing Live at the Kumbaya festival in 1995
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Kumbaya was a festival held at the Molson Amphiteatre to benefit people living with aids which was broadcast live across Canada on Much Music
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 They were removed from the rebroadcast the next day and their performance was replaced with an REM video
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Over the course of the mid-1990s, the band's line-up would change several times
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Guitarist Wilde left in 1994 and was replaced the following year by Kurf
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Soon after, Kieran moved to the UK where he toured with The Varukers and formed The Restarts
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 He was replaced by Rick Giroux, who was in turn replaced in 1997 by former Heatseekers and Suckerpunch bassist, Cindy Beattie
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The debut full-length, "It's About Fucking Time", was recorded over much of 1996 and 1997 and features both Rick and Cindy
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The CD also features re-recordings of many of the songs from earlier releases
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It also spent some time in the independent charts in Canada
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

In 1998, Kurf left the band and in 1999 was replaced by former Abalienation guitarist, Mark Dickinson
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In 2000, following the release of The Negative Aspect of Positive Thinking CD, Mark returned to the US, leaving Armed and Hammered once again with one guitarist
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In 2000, Mopa left the group to be replaced by Jaww singer, Doug McLarty
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 After Mopa's departure the group became mostly inactive, playing only a handful of gigs before their final shows in early 2003
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Mopa formed The G-Men in 2002, who played at least one gig with Armed & Hammered, on November 15, 2002 at Sneaky Dee's in Toronto
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 These final shows featured the return of former members Kurf and Rick
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Abalone is an award-winning two-player abstract strategy board game designed by Michel Lalet and Laurent Lévi in 1987
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Players are represented by opposing black and white marbles on a hexagonal board with the objective of pushing six of the opponent's marbles off the edge of the board
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The game is arranged similar to Chinese checkers but without starting spaces and with a "moat" around the edge of the board
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Players start with 14 marbles instead of 10, there are only two "colors", and the starting arrangement is different
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 But the game also uses a hexagon with marbles and 5 pits on each edge
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Abalone was published in 1990 and has sold more than 4
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
5 million units
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The year it was published it received one of the first Mensa Select awards in New York, New York
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is currently sold in more than thirty countries
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
The abampere (abA), also called the biot (Bi) after Jean-Baptiste Biot, is the basic electromagnetic unit of electric current in the emu-cgs system of units (electromagnetic cgs)
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 One abampere is equal to ten amperes in the SI system of units
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 An abampere of current in a circular path of one centimeter radius produces a magnetic field of 2π oersteds at the center of the circle
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The emu-cgs (or "electromagnetic cgs") units are one of several systems of electromagnetic units within the centimetre gram second system of units; others include esu-cgs, Gaussian units, and Lorentz–Heaviside units
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In these other systems, the abampere is not one of the units; the "statcoulomb per second" or statampere is used instead
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The other units in this system related to the abampere are:
abcoulomb – the charge that passes in one second through any cross section of a conductor carrying a steady current of one abampere
abhenry – the self-inductance of a circuit or the mutual inductance of two circuits in which the variation of current at the rate of one abampere per second results in an induced electromotive force of one abvolt
abohm – the resistance of a conductor that, with a constant current of one abampere through it, maintains between its terminals a potential difference of one abvolt
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Self-abasement is voluntary self-punishment or humiliation in order to atone for some real or imagined wrongdoing
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Self-abasement might have a religious aspect for those seeking humility before God, perhaps in the context of monastic or cenobitic lifestyle
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

It also has a sexual and fetish aspect for those people who enjoy erotic humiliation and other related BDSM practices
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Examples of self-abasement practices include self-flagellation, bondage, torture, public humiliation (including online humiliation)
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

In psychology, self-abasement is associated with shame (rather than guilt) and involves the reduction of the subject's self-esteem
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The notion of self-abasement can be said to be based in Freudian psychoanalysis
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Fear may also result in self-abasement
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Kang So-ra (born February 18, 1990) is a South Korean actress
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Abasia (from Greek: a-, without and basis, step) is the inability to walk owing to impairment in motor coordination
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The term covers a spectrum of medical disorders such as:
choreic abasia: caused by chorea of the legs
paralytic abasia: caused by paralysis of the leg muscles
spastic abasia: caused by spastic stiffening of the leg muscles
trembling abasia: caused by trembling of the legs
Abasia is frequently accompanied by astasis, an inability to stand, see Astasia-abasia
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
An abatis, abattis, or abbattis is a field fortification consisting of an obstacle formed (in the modern era) of the branches of trees laid in a row, with the sharpened tops directed outwards, towards the enemy
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The trees are usually interlaced or tied with wire
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Abatis are used alone or in combination with wire entanglements and other obstacles
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
A lampshade is a fixture that covers the lightbulb on a lamp to diffuse the light it emits
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Conical, cylindrical and other forms on floor-, desk- or table top-mounted as well as suspended lamp models are the most common and are made in a wide range of materials
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The term can also apply to the glass hung under many designs of ceiling lamp
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Beyond its practical purpose, significant emphasis is also usually given to decorative and aesthetic features
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------



 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
An abatis, abattis, or abbattis is a field fortification consisting of an obstacle formed (in the modern era) of the branches of trees laid in a row, with the sharpened tops directed outwards, towards the enemy
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The trees are usually interlaced or tied with wire
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Abatis are used alone or in combination with wire entanglements and other obstacles
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
A slaughterhouse or abattoir  is a facility where animals are slaughtered for consumption as food
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Slaughterhouses supply meat which then becomes the responsibility of the packaging department
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------


Slaughterhouses that process meat not intended for human consumption are sometimes referred to as knacker's yards or knackeries, used for animals that are not fit for consumption or can no longer work on a farm such as work horses that can no longer work
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Slaughtering animals on a large scale poses significant logistical problems, animal welfare problems, public health requirements, and environmental problems
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Due to public aversion in many cultures, determining where to build slaughterhouses is also troubling
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

Animal welfare and animal rights groups frequently raise concerns about the methods of transport, preparation, herding, and killing within some slaughterhouses under the example of animal rights activists such as Howard Lyman and Ric O'Barry
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
ABBA (Swedish pronunciation: [²abːa]) were a Swedish pop group, formed in Stockholm in 1972 by members Agnetha Fältskog, Björn Ulvaeus, Benny Andersson, and Anni-Frid Lyngstad
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 They became one of the most commercially successful acts in the history of popular music, topping the charts worldwide from 1974 to 1982
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 ABBA won the Eurovision Song Contest 1974 at The Dome in Brighton, UK, giving Sweden its first triumph in the contest, and are the most successful group to have ever taken part in the competition
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

ABBA's record sales figure is uncertain and various estimates range from over 140 to over 500 million sold records
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 This makes them one of the best-selling music artists of all time
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 They are also the best-selling band of all time from continental Europe and from outside the English-speaking world
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 ABBA were the first group from a non-English-speaking country to achieve consistent success in the charts of English-speaking countries, including the United Kingdom, Ireland, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, and the United States
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 They have a joint record eight consecutive number-one albums in the UK
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The group also enjoyed significant success in Latin America, and recorded a collection of their hit songs in Spanish
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

During the band's active years, Fältskog & Ulvaeus and Lyngstad & Andersson were married
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 At the height of their popularity, both relationships were suffering strain which ultimately resulted in the collapse of the Ulvaeus–Fältskog marriage in 1979 and the Andersson–Lyngstad marriage in 1981
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 These relationship changes were reflected in the group's music, with later compositions featuring more introspective and dark lyrics in contrast to their usual pure-pop sound
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

After ABBA disbanded in December 1982, Andersson and Ulvaeus achieved success writing music for the stage, while Lyngstad and Fältskog pursued solo careers with mixed success
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 ABBA's music declined in popularity until the purchase of ABBA's catalogue and record company Polar by Polygram in 1989 enabled the groundwork to be laid for an international re-issue of all their original material and a new Greatest Hits (ABBA Gold) collection in September 1992 which became a worldwide smash
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Several films, notably Muriel's Wedding (1994) and The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert (1994), further revived public interest in the group and the spawning of several tribute bands
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In 1999, ABBA's music was adapted into the successful musical Mamma Mia! that toured worldwide
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 A film of the same name, released in 2008, became the highest-grossing film in the United Kingdom that year
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

ABBA were honoured at the 50th anniversary celebration of the Eurovision Song Contest in 2005, when their hit "Waterloo" was chosen as the best song in the competition's history
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The group was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2010
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In 2015, their song "Dancing Queen" was inducted into the Recording Academy's Grammy Hall of Fame
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
To Lua Foto (died 614) was Abbot of Clonmacnoise
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

To Lua Foto was a member of the Corco Moga of what is now north-east County Galway
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The Corco Moga's homeland was based around what is now the parish of Kilkerrin
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In the 10th century, the area was conquered by the Ui Briuin, who established a new dynasty of the Ui Diarmata as rulers
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

He was preceded as abbot by Ailither and succeeded by Colman Moccu Bairdene
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Abbati is an Italian surname
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Notable people with the surname include:
Giuseppe Abbati (1836-1868), Italian artist
Pietro Abbati (1768-1842), Italian mathematician
Pietro Giovanni Abbati (1683-1745), Italian set designer, painter, and engraver
Stefano Abbati (born 1955), Italian actor
Vincenzo Abbati (1803–1874?), Italian painter
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
In Christianity, an abbess (Latin abbatissa, feminine form of abbas, abbot) is the female superior of a community of nuns, which is often an abbey
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
An abbey is a complex of buildings used by members of a religious order under the governance of an abbot or abbess
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It provides a place for religious activities, work and housing of Christian monks and nuns
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The concept of the abbey has developed over many centuries from the early monastic ways of religious men and women where they would live isolated from the lay community about them
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Religious life in an abbey may be monastic
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 An abbey may be the home of an enclosed religious order or may be open to visitors
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The layout of the church and associated buildings of an abbey often follows a set plan determined by the founding religious order
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Abbeys are often self-sufficient while using any abundance of produce or skill to provide care to the poor and needy, refuge to the persecuted or education to the young
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Some abbeys offer accommodation to people who are seeking spiritual retreat
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 There are many famous abbeys across Europe
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Abbot, meaning father, is an ecclesiastical title given to the male head of a monastery in various traditions, including Christianity
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The office may also be given as an honorary title to a clergyman who is not the head of a monastery
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The female equivalent is abbess
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
An abbreviation (from Latin brevis, meaning short) is a shortened form of a word or phrase
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It consists of a group of letters taken from the word or phrase
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 For example, the word abbreviation can itself be represented by the abbreviation abbr
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
, abbrv
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
, or abbrev
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

In strict analysis, abbreviations should not be confused with contractions, crasis, acronyms, or initialisms, with which they share some semantic and phonetic functions, though all four are connoted by the term "abbreviation" in loose parlance
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
An abbreviation is a shortening by any method; a contraction is a reduction of size by the drawing together of the parts
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 A contraction of a word is made by omitting certain letters or syllables and bringing together the first and last letters or elements; an abbreviation may be made by omitting certain portions from the interior or by cutting off a part
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 A contraction is an abbreviation, but an abbreviation is not necessarily a contraction
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Acronyms and initialisms are regarded as subsets of abbreviations (e
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
g
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 by the Council of Science Editors)
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 They are abbreviations that consist of the initial letters or parts of words
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Sphenophorus abbreviatus is a true weevil species in the genus Sphenophorus
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
The abcoulomb (abC or aC) or electromagnetic unit of charge (emu of charge) is the basic physical unit of electric charge in the cgs-emu system of units
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 One abcoulomb is equal to ten coulombs
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

CGS-emu (or "electromagnetic cgs") units are one of several systems of electromagnetic units within the centimetre gram second system of units; others include CGS-esu, Gaussian units, and Lorentz–Heaviside units
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In these other systems, the abcoulomb is not used; CGS-esu and Gaussian units use the statcoulomb is instead, while the Lorentz-Heaviside unit of charge has no specific name
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

In the electromagnetic cgs system, electric current is a fundamental quantity defined via Ampère's law and takes the permeability as a dimensionless quantity (relative permeability) whose value in a vacuum is unity
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 As a consequence, the square of the speed of light appears explicitly in some of the equations interrelating quantities in this system
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The definition of the abcoulomb follows from that of the abampere: given two parallel currents of one abampere separated by one centimetre, the force per distance of wire is 2 dyn/cm
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The abcoulomb is the charge flowing in 1 second given a current of 1 abampere
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
Abdāl (lit: substitutes, but which can also mean "generous" [karīm] and "noble" [sharīf]) is a term used in Islamic metaphysics and Islamic mysticism, both Sunni and Shiite, to refer to a particularly important group of God's saints
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In the tradition of Sunni Islam in particular, the concept attained an especially important position in the writings of the Sunni mystics and theologians, whence it appears in the works of Sunni authorities as diverse as Abu Talib al-Makki (d
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 956), Ali Hujwiri (d
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 1072), Ibn Asakir (d
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 1076), Khwaja Abdullah Ansari (d
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 1088), and Ibn Khaldun (d
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 1406)
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

It is a rank of forty saints, but more often the larger group of 356 saints in Sufi hagiography
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In this theology it is said that they are only known to and appointed by Allah, and it is through their operations that the world continues to exist
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The term over time has come to include a greater hierarchy of saints, all of different rank and prestige
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

"Abdal" is the plural of "Badal" or rather "Badeel", and means "those who get replaced", "those who serve as a partial replacement to the role of the prophets" or "friends of God"
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 The Abdals are the group of true, pure believers in God
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 They serve God during their lifetime; when they die, they are immediately replaced by another selected by God from a larger group said to be the 500 "Akhyar", i
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
e
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
, the semi-divine good ones
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The Abdals are headed by their leader, "Al-Ghawth" ("the Helper"), who is said to reside in Mecca
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 This leader is often referred to as the Qutb, which means "Pole" in Arabic
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 This leader though unknown to the public is usually sought out by all of the lower ranking members of the abdal
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 At various times in history, shaykhs have been known to publicly claim to be the Qutb, despite the tradition of remaining outside of the public eye
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The missions of the Abdals are to be God's merciful subjects everywhere they reside and to render the helping blessing hand to all of God's creatures
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

It is said that a Badal exists in each continent
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Although the majority live in "Al-Sham (Syria),"
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
some live in Iraq, some in Lebanon, some in Egypt, some in Antioch, some in al-Massisa, South Africa and others live throughout the rest of the world
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
"
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 They have divine powers and super-natural abilities
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 A person does not recognize that he is one of the Abdal until he becomes aware of his status suddenly though a revelation
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is said that a Badal can be identified through his continuous good deeds and forgiving nature
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 He may be rich or poor, married or bachelor, child or adult
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Such concepts are established in the Sunni branch of Islam, and in particular in the latter’s original Sufi schools of spiritual disciplines
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The abdal function as the keepers of equilibrium in the world and preserve it between the times when prophets are present
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Varying in classification and denomination, the identity of the abdal are entirely unknown to the public and even to themselves
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 With the ability to transmit blessings (baraka) and perform miracles (karāmāt) the abdal as a whole are able to adequately fill the role of prophet
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Similarly, it is believed that when judgement day comes, they will act as intermediaries (šafāʿa) between God and the human race
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

As far as the number of the abdal is concerned, there are 300 friends of Allah in the creation whose hearts are like that of Adam
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 There are 40 whose hearts are similar to the heart of Musa and 7 whose hearts are similar to the heart of Ibrahim
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 There are 5 whose hearts are like that of Jibra’il and 3 whose hearts are like that of Mika’il and one whose heart is like the heart of Israfil
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 When he (whose heart is like Israfil) dies, then one of the three whose heart is like Mika’il replaces him and one of the five (whose hearts are like Jibra’il) replaces him
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 One of the seven replaces one of the five, one of the forty replaces one of the seven and one of the three-hundred replaces one of the forty and a normal Muslim replaces one of the three-hundred
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is due to these 356 awliya that creation are given life and killed, due to them rain falls, vegetation grows and difficulties are removed
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It is also believed that since the number of abdal is so near to the number of days in the lunar calendar, their role as a part of the cosmic order of the universe is justified
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

In Sufism, the Abdal are placed in a cosmic hierarchy with other orders of saintly individuals
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 Two descriptions of the hierarchy come from notable Sufis
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 One comes from the 12th Century persian Ali Hujwiri
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 In his divine court, there are three hundred akhyār (“excellent ones”), forty abdāl (“substitutes”), seven abrār (“piously devoted ones”), four awtād (“pillars”) three nuqabā (“leaders”) and one qutb
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------

The second version is from Ibn Arabī, who lived in Moorish Spain
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 It has a more exclusive structure
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
 There are eight nujabā (“nobles”), twelve nuqabā, seven abdāl, four awtād, two a’immah (“guides”), and the qutb
 -----------------------------END---------------------------------
